gurmukhi: <> siqgur pRswid ]
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: 1 gurisK - ivkwrwN qoN pry hY ]
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: kwm lK kir kwmnw bhu rUpI sohY
transliteration: Kaam Lakh Kari Kaamanaa Bahu Roopee Sohai.
translation: Passionate urges in the form of lacs of desires may appear in many forms.

gurmukhi: lK krop kroD kir dusmn huie johY
transliteration: Lakh Karodh Karodh Kari Dousaman Hoi Johai.
translation: Lacs of enemies may stare in anger; temptations in lacs and lacs of mammons may inveigle and deceive;

gurmukhi: lK loB lK lKmI huie Dohx DohY
transliteration: Lakh Lobh Lakh Lakhamee Hoi Dhohan Dhohai.
translation: Maya and infatuation pretending to be virtuous may in crores of ways adorne(the world);

gurmukhi: mwieAw moih kroV imil huie bhu gux sohY
transliteration: Maaiaa Mohi Karorh Mili Ho Bahu Goun Sohai.
translation: And ego, full of pride for having killed lacs of demons, may touch a gursikh;

gurmukhi: Asur sMGwir hMkwr lK haumY kir CohY
transliteration: Asur Sanghaari Hankaar Lakh Haoumai Kari Chhohai.
translation: But to the Sikh of the Guru, who listens to the teachings of the Guru in the holy congregation,

gurmukhi: swDsMgiq guru isK suix guru isK n pohY ]1]
transliteration: Saadhasangati Guru Sikh Souni Guru Sikh N Pohai ?1?
translation: They all cannot affect the least.

gurmukhi: 2 gurisK - kwmI nhIN
translation: Sexual urges do not touch the Sikh of the Guru -

gurmukhi: lK kwmix lK kwmrUp lK kwmixAwrI
transliteration: Lakh Kaamani Lakh Kaavaroo Lakh Kaamaniaaree.
translation: Lacs of magician women of lacs of kamaraps (a state in east India where women were supposed to be very beautiful);

gurmukhi: sMgldIphuN pdmxI bhu rUip sIgwrI
transliteration: Singal Deepahoun Padamanee Bahu Roopi Seegaaree.
translation: The best category of women (Padrnini) of Shilialdvi:p (modern Sri Lanka) adept in embellishments;

gurmukhi: mohxIAwN ieMdRwpurI ApCrwN sucwrI
transliteration: Mohaneeaan Indraa Puree Apachharaa Souchaaree.
translation: Chaste nymphs of Indralok (the abode of Indr, the Vedic god),

gurmukhi: hUrwN prIAwN lK lK bihsq svwrI
transliteration: Hooraan Pareeaan Lakh Lakh Lakh Bahisat Savaaree.
translation: Houris of paradise and fairies in lacs;

gurmukhi: lK kaulwN nv jobnI lK kwm krwrI
transliteration: Lakh Kaulaan Nav Jobanee Lakh Kaam Karaaree.
translation: Lacs of young girls adept in sexual arts also cannot touch

gurmukhi: gurmuiK poih n sknI swDsMgiq BwrI ]2]
transliteration: Guramoukhi Pohi N Sakanee Saadhasangati Bhaaree ?2?
translation: The gurmukh who resides in the grand holy congregation.

gurmukhi: 3 gurisK - hMkwr dI mwroN pry hn
translation: The Sikh of Guru is beyond the sway of ego -

gurmukhi: lK durXoDn kMs lK lK dYq lVMdy
transliteration: Lakh Durayojan Kans Lakh Lakh Dait Larhanday.
translation: Lacs of Duryodhan, Kans and lacs of demons may be there who keep fighting;

gurmukhi: lK rwvx kuMBkrx lK lK rwks mMdy
transliteration: Lakh Raavan Kounbhakaran Lakh Lakh Raakas Manday.
translation: Lacs of Ravans, Kumbhakarans and other evil demons there may be;

gurmukhi: prsrwm lK shNsbwhu kir KudI KhMdy
transliteration: Parasaraam Lakh Sahasabaahu Kari Khudee Khahanday.
translation: Lacs of Padu Rams and Sahsrbahus may be wrangling in ego with one another;

gurmukhi: hrnksp hrxwksw nrisMG bukMdy
transliteration: Haranaakas Bahu Haranaakasaa Narasingh Boukanday.
translation: Many may be there like Hiranyakasipu and the roaring man-lion Narsinghs;

gurmukhi: lK kroD ivroD lK lK vYru krMdy
transliteration: Lakh Karodh Virodh Lakh Lakh Vairu Karanday.
translation: Lacs of angry people with lacs of antagonisms and lacs of enmities may be there.

gurmukhi: guru isK poih n skeI swDsMig imlMdy ]3]
transliteration: Guru Sikh Pohi N Sakaee Saadhasangi Miladay ?3?
translation: They all cannot put any harm to the Sikhs of the Guru who gather in the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: 4 gurisK loBI nhIN
translation: The Sikh of the Guru does not fall a prey to greed

gurmukhi: soienw rupw lK mxw lK Bry BMfwrw
transliteration: Soinaa Roupaa Lakh Manaa Lakh Bharay Bhandaaraa.
translation: Lacs of mounds of gold and rupees and lacs of filled up store houses;

gurmukhi: moqI mwixk hIirAwN bhu mol Apwrw
transliteration: Motee Maanik Heeriaan Bahu Mol Apaaraa.
translation: Invaluable pearls, rubies and diamonds;

gurmukhi: dys vys lK rwj Bwg prgxy hjwrw
transliteration: Days Vays Lakh Raaj Bhaag Paraganay Hajaaraa.
translation: Lacs of kingdoms, countries and thousands of paraganas (districts);

gurmukhi: irDI isDI jog Bog ABrx sIgwrw
transliteration: Ridhee Sidhee Jog Bhog Abharan Seegaaraa.
translation: Riddhis, siddhis (miraculous powers), renunciations, enjoyments, ornaments. embellishments;

gurmukhi: kwmDynu lK pwrjwiq icMqwmix pwrw
transliteration: Kaamadhaynu Lakh Paarijaati Chintaamani Paaraa.
translation: Kantdhenus, the wishfulfilling cows, lacs of wishfulfilling trees (parijats) and fabulous gems;

gurmukhi: cwr pdwrQ sgl Pl lK loB auBwrw
transliteration: Chaar Padaarad Sagal Phal Lakh Lobh Loubhaaraa.
translation: All the four ideals of life (dhrma, arth, Kam and moks);

gurmukhi: gur isK poh n hMGnI swDsMig auDwrw ]4]
transliteration: Gur Sikh Poh N Hanghanee Saadhasangi Udhaaraa ?4?
translation: And lacs of attractive fruits and other temptations cannot even touch that Sikh of the Guru who has got liberated in the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: 5 gurisK moh rihq hY
translation: Gursikh is devoid of infatuation

gurmukhi: ipau puq mwvV DIvVI huie BYx iBrwvw
transliteration: Piu Poutu Maavarh Dheearhee Hoi Bhain Bhiraavaa.
translation: Father, son, mother, daughter, sister, brother are there.

gurmukhi: nwir Bqwru ipAwr lK mn myl imlwvw
transliteration: Naari Bhataaru Piaar Lakh Man Mayli Milaavaa.
translation: Husband and wife love each other profusely with their hearts.

gurmukhi: suMdr mMdr icqRswl bwg Pul suhwvw
transliteration: Soundar Mandar Chitrasaal Baag Phul Suhaavaa.
translation: Pleasure-giving beautiful palaces, art galleries, gardens and flowers are all delightful.

gurmukhi: rwg rMg rs rUp lK bhu Bog Bulwvw
transliteration: Raag Rang Ras Roop Lakh Bahu Bhog Bhulaavaa.
translation: Lacs of sounds, colours, flowers and forms delude people in enjoyments.

gurmukhi: lK mwieAw lK moih imil huie mudeI dwvw
transliteration: Lakh Maaiaa Lakh Mohi Mili Hoi Mudaee Daavaa.
translation: Getting engrossed in millions types of infatuations people have manyfold claims (over each other).

gurmukhi: guru isK poih n hMGnI swDsMg suhwvw ]5]
transliteration: Guru Sikh Pohi N Hanghanee Saadhasangu Suhaavaa ?5?
translation: To the Sikhs of the Guru, adorning the holy congregation, even all these cannot affect in any way.

gurmukhi: 6 gurisK- KudI qoN KwlI hY
translation: The Sikh of the Guru is devoid of ego-

gurmukhi: vrnwvrn n BwvnI kir KudI KhMdy
transliteration: Varanaa Varan N Bhaavanee Kari Khudee Khahanday.
translation: All the vamas (castes) do not love one another and quarrel among themselves in ego;

gurmukhi: jMgl AMdir sINh duie blvMq bukMdy
transliteration: Jangal Andari Seenh Dui Balavanti Boukanday.
translation: If there are two lions in a jungle they roar mightily at each other.

gurmukhi: hwQI hiQAweI krn mqvwly huie AVI AVMdy
transliteration: Haadee Hadiaaee Karani Matavaalay Hui Arhee Arhanday.
translation: They all are like those intoxicated elephants which stubbornly fight each other.

gurmukhi: rwj BUp rwjy vfy ml dys lVMdy
transliteration: Raaj Bhoop Raajay Vaday Mal Days Larhanday.
translation: The mighty kings capture large territories and fight with each other.

gurmukhi: mulk AMdr pwqswh duie jwie jMg juVMdy
transliteration: Mulak Andari Paatisaah Dui Jaai Jang Jurhanday.
translation: Two emperors in a country will go at war with each another.

gurmukhi: haumY kir hMkwr lK ml ml GulMdy
transliteration: Haoumai Kari Hankaar Lakh Mal Mal Ghuladay.
translation: Guided and controlled by ego lacs of wrestlers wrestle with one another.

gurmukhi: guru isK poih n sknI swDu sMig vsMdy ]6]
transliteration: Guru Sikh Pohi N Sakanee Saadhu Sangi Vasanday ?6?
translation: But ego cannot touch the Sikhs of the Guru residing in the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: 7 gurisK - inr hMkwr jqI hY
translation: The Sikh of the Guru is prideless -

gurmukhi: gorK jqI sdwieMdw iqsu gur GrbwrI
transliteration: Gorakh Jatee Sadaaindaa Tisu Guru Gharibaaree.
translation: Gorakh claimed to be a celebate but his teacher Machhandar (Matsyendr) lived like a virtual householder.

gurmukhi: sukr kwxw hoieAw durmMqR vIcwrI
transliteration: Soukar Kaanaa Hoiaa Mantee Avichaaree.
translation: Sukrachary too was stigmatised for his evil mantra.

gurmukhi: lKmx swDI BuK qyh haumY AhMkwrI
transliteration: Lakhaman Saadhee Bhoukh Tayh Haoumai Ahankaaree.
translation: Laksaman disciplined his hunger and thirst and was proud on this account.

gurmukhi: hnUMmwn blvMq hoie cMcl miq KwrI
transliteration: Hanoonmat Balavant Aakheeai Chanchal Mati Khaaree.
translation: Hanumán (monkey god) is known to be very powerful but his mind was quite volatile.

gurmukhi: BYrau BUq kusUq sMig durmiq aurDwrI
transliteration: Bhairau Bhoot Kasoot Sangi Duramati Uradhaaree.
translation: Bhairav also because of his association with evil spirits maintained his evilmindedness.

gurmukhi: gurisK jqI slwhIAin ijin haumY mwrI ]7]
transliteration: Gurasikh Jatee Salaaheeani Jini Haoumai Maaree ?7?
translation: Sikhs of the Guru who have effaced their ego are praised as (really) virtuous persons.

gurmukhi: 8 gurisK - sqI
translation: The Sikh of the Guru is the follower of truth -

gurmukhi: hrI cMd siq riKAw jwie inKws ivkwxw
transliteration: Haree Chand Sati Rakhiaa Jaai Nikhaas Vikaanaa.
translation: Harischandr abided by truth and got himself sold in the market place.

gurmukhi: bl CilAw sq pwldw pwqwil isDwxw
transliteration: Bal Chhaliaa Satu Paaladaa Paataali Sidhaanaa.
translation: Though duped (by Visnu), King Bali observed truth and went to the netherworld.

gurmukhi: krnu su kMcn dwn kir AMqu pCoqwxw
transliteration: Karanu Su Kanchan Daan Kari Antu Pachhotaanaa.
translation: Karn would also give gold in charity but he had to repent ultimately (because god Indr demanded his armour ana earrings of him which he readily gave and lost his powers).

gurmukhi: siqvwdI huie Drm puqu kUV jmpuir jwxw
transliteration: Sativaadee Hui Dharamapoutu Koorh Jamapuri Jaanaa.
translation: The truthful Yudhisthar, son of Yama, for his one lie had to go to hell.

gurmukhi: jqI sqI sMqoKIAw haumY grbwxw
transliteration: Jatee Satee Santokheeaa Haoumai Garabaanaa.
translation: Many celebates, truthful and contented people have flourished but they all were proud of their conduct.

gurmukhi: gurisK rom n pujnI bhu mwx inmwxw ]8]
transliteration: Gurasikh Rom N Pujanee Bahu Maan Nimaanaa ?8?
translation: Such a humble one is the Sikh of the Guru that all these are not equal to his one trichome.

gurmukhi: 9 gurisK - ihMdU muslmwn qoN au`cw hY
translation: Gursikh is above the feelings of Hindu and Muslim -

gurmukhi: muslmwxwN ihMdUAwN duie rwh clwey
transliteration: Mousalamaanaa Hindooaan Dui Raah Chalaaay.
translation: Hindus and Muslims have started two separate ways (of life).

gurmukhi: mjhb vrn gxwieNdy guru pIru sdwey
transliteration: Majahab Varan Ganaainday Guru Peeru Sadaaay.
translation: Muslims count their mazahabs (sects) and Hindus count their varnas (castes) and call themselves pirs and gurus respectively.

gurmukhi: isK murId pKMf kir aupdys diRVwey
transliteration: Sikh Mureed Pakhand Kari Oupadays Drirhaaay.
translation: Through pretension and hypocrisy they make people their followers (Sikhs and murtils) whom they give instruction.

gurmukhi: rwm rhIm iDAwieNdy haumY grbwey
transliteration: Raam Raheem Dhiaainday Haoumai Garabaaay.
translation: Adoring Ram and and Rahtm they remain conceited in their sense of ego.

gurmukhi: mkw gMg bnwrsI pUj jwrq Awey
transliteration: Makaa Gang Banaarasee Pooj Jaarat Aaay.
translation: Separately, they go for pilgrimage and worship to Mecca, Ganges and Banaras.

gurmukhi: rojy vrq nmwz kir fMfauq krwey
transliteration: Rojay Varat Namaaj Kari Dandaouti Karaaay.
translation: They observe rozas, vrats (fasts), namaz and prostration (Muslim and Hindu way of worship).

gurmukhi: guru isK rom n pujnI jo Awpu gvwey ]9]
transliteration: Guru Sikh Rom N Pujanee Jo Aapu Gavaaay ?9?
translation: They all are not equal to even one trichome of a Gum's Sikh who has effaced his sense of ego.

gurmukhi: 10 gurisK ihMdI mq mqwNqRwN qoN au`cw
translation: Gursikh is above all religions and sects

gurmukhi: iCA drsn vrqwieAw caudh Knvwdy
transliteration: Chhia Darasan Varataaiaa Chaudah Khanavaaday.
translation: There are six schools of philosophy and fourteen lineages (of the Sufis).

gurmukhi: GrY GuMim GrbwrIAw Asvwr ipAwdy
transliteration: Gharai Ghoonmi Gharabaareeaa Asavaar Piaaday.
translation: Householders, riders and foot soldiers move about in circles in the world.

gurmukhi: sMinAwsI ds nwm Dir kir vwd kvwdy
transliteration: Sanniaasee Das Naam Dhari Kari Vaad Kavaaday.
translation: Maintaining ten names, the sanyasi sects go on debating among themselves.

gurmukhi: rwvl bwrh pMQ kir iPrdy audmwdy
transliteration: Raaval Baarah Pand Kari Dhiraday Udamaaday.
translation: Ravals, the yogis, also split in twelve sects and roam mad with pride.

gurmukhi: jYnI jUT n auqrY jUTy prswdy
transliteration: Jainee Jootd N Outarai Jootday Parasaaday.
translation: Leftover is grace for Jains and their contamination is never removed.

gurmukhi: guru isK rom n pujnI Duir Awid jugwdy ]10]
transliteration: Guru Sikh Rom N Pujanee Dhuri Aadi Jougaaday ?10?
translation: They all are not equal to one trichome of that Gursikh who has attuned himself with that great primeval Lord.

gurmukhi: 11 gur isK AMnRX dySI qy AMnRX DrmIAwN qoN aucw hY
translation: Gursikh is above other indigenous and foreign religions

gurmukhi: bhu suMnI sIA rwPjI mjhb mn Bwxy
transliteration: Bahu Sounnee Seea Raadhasee Majahab Mani Bhaanay.
translation: Many people are there of attractive sects of Sunnis, Sias and Rafazts.

gurmukhi: mulihd hoie munwPkw sB Brim Bulwxy
transliteration: Mulahid Hoi Mounaadhakaa Sabh Bharami Bhulaanay.
translation: Many hypocrites becoming atheists and deluded by illusions go on wandering here and there.

gurmukhi: eIsweI mUsweIAwN haumY hYrwxy
transliteration: Eesaaee Moosaaeeaan Haoumai Hairaanay.
translation: Followers of Jesus and Moses are also many who are confounded in their own pride.

gurmukhi: hoie iPrMgI ArmnI rUmI grbwxy
transliteration: Hoi Dhirangee Aramanee Roomee Garabaanay.
translation: Some are blackclad recluses and dervishes wearing bunches of cowaries

gurmukhi: kwlI pos klMdrw drvys dugwxy
transliteration: Kaalee Pos Kaladaraan Daravays Dougaanay.
translation: Around their arms who move about here and there.

gurmukhi: guru isK rom n pujnI gur hit ivkwxy ]11]
transliteration: Guru Sikh Rom N Pujanee Gur Hati Vikaanay ?11?
translation: They all are not equal to even a trichome of those Gursikhs who have sold themselves at the hands of the Guru.

gurmukhi: 12 gur isK krm Drm qoN au`cw suKPl ivc hY
translation: Gursikh is above ritualism and lives in the pleasure-fruit

gurmukhi: jp qp sMjm swDnw hT ingH krxy
transliteration: Jap Tap Sanjam Saadhanaa Hatd Nigrah Karanay.
translation: Actions such as recitations, austerities, continence, devotion, perseverence, control over senses, etc. are performed.

gurmukhi: vrq nym qIrQ Gxy AiDAwqm Drxy
transliteration: Varat Naym Teerad Ghanay Adhiaatam Dharanay.
translation: For spirituality, fasts, observances, pilgrimages are undertaken.

gurmukhi: dyvI dyvw dyhury pUjw prvrxy
transliteration: Dayvee Dayvaa Dayhuray Poojaa Paravaranay.
translation: One gets inclined towards temples for the worship of gods and goddesses.

gurmukhi: hom jg bhu dwn kir muK vyd aucrxy
transliteration: Hom Jag Bahu Daan Kari Moukh Vayd Oucharanay.
translation: Besides burnt offerings and charities of many kinds, Vedic hymns are chanted.

gurmukhi: krm Drm BY Brm ivic bhu jMmx mrxy
transliteration: Karam Dharam Bhai Bharam Vichi Bahu Janman Maranay.
translation: Getting stuck in such religious, ritualistic illusions, fear and doubt only leads to transmigration.

gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Pl swDsMig imil duqru qrxy ]12]
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phal Saadhasangi Mili Douturu Taranay ?12?
translation: The pleasure fruit of gurmukhs is the holy congregation meeting which the ardous world-ocean is crossed.

gurmukhi: audy Asiq ivic rwj kir ckÍriq Gnyry
transliteration: Uday Asati Vichi Raaj Kari Chakravarati Ghanayray.
translation: Many such kings are there whose kingdom extends from the point of sunrise to the point of sunset.

gurmukhi: Arb Krb lY drb iniD rs Boig cMgyry
transliteration: Arab Kharab Lai Darab Nidhi Ras Bhogi Changayray.
translation: They have wealth worth billions and choice luxuries to enjoy.

gurmukhi: nrpiq surpiq CqRpiq haumY ivic Gyry
transliteration: Narapati Surapati Chhatrapati Haoumai Vichi Ghayray.
translation: All these kings of mortals and gods are engrossed in their ego.

gurmukhi: isv lokhuN cViH bHm lok bYkuMT vsyry
transliteration: Siv Lokahu Charhhi Braham Lok Baikountd Vasayray.
translation: Rising from the abode of Siva they attain the abode of Brahma and Vaikunth, the heavens;

gurmukhi: icr jIvxu bhu hMFxw hoih vfy vfyry
transliteration: Chir Jeevanu Bahu Handdhanaa Hohi Vaday Vadayray.
translation: Many other long-lived have also flourished,

gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Pl Agmu hY huie Bly Blyry ]13]
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Agamu Hai Hoi Bhalay Bhalayray ?13?
translation: But the pleasure fruit of gurmukhs is unapproachable and better than the best one.

gurmukhi: 14 gurisK ieMdRX suKwN qoN au`cy suK Pl ivc hY
translation: Gursikh's pleasure fruit transcends sensual pleasures

gurmukhi: rUp AnUp srUp lK huie rMg ibrMgI
transliteration: Roopu Anoop Saroop Lakh Hoi Rang Birangee.
translation: Millions of variegated creatures of unparallel beauty are there in this world.

gurmukhi: rwg nwd sMbwd lK sMgiq ABMgI
transliteration: Raag Naad Sanbaad Lakh Sangeet Abhangee.
translation: Likewise millions of vibrations, dialogues and their constant music is there.

gurmukhi: gMD sugMiD imlwp lK Argjy AdMgI
transliteration: Gandh Sougandhi Milaap Lakh Aragajay Adangee.
translation: Mixing many scents millions of pure essences are prepared.

gurmukhi: CqIh Bojn pwkswl rs Bog suFMgI
transliteration: Chhateeh Bhojan Paakasaal Ras Bhog Suddhangee.
translation: Similarly in cook houses thirtysix types of delicious dishes are there.

gurmukhi: pwt ptMbr gihixAwN sohihN srbMgI
transliteration: Paat Patanbar Gahaniaan Sohahi Sarabangee.
translation: The fully grown up women are there decorated with silken robes and ornaments.

gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Pl Agm hY guruisK shlMgI ]14]
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Aganmu Hai Gurousikh Sahalagee ?14?
translation: But association with the gurmukhs is a pleasure fruit which is unapproachable.

gurmukhi: 15 gurisK mn bu`DI dy suKwN qoN au`cy suK ivc hY
translation: Gursikh enjoys the delight higher than the pleasures of mind and intellect)

gurmukhi: lK miq buiD suiD aukiq lK lK lK cqurweI
transliteration: Lakh Mati Budhi Sudhi Oukati Lakh Lakh Lakh Chaturaaee.
translation: Plenty of practical arts, spiritual wisdom, wise sayings and skills are extent (upto day).

gurmukhi: lK bl bcn ibbyk lK prikriq kmweI
transliteration: Lakh Bal Bachan Bibayk Lakh Parakirati Kamaaee.
translation: Lacs of powers, discretions, discourses and physical services are known.

gurmukhi: lK isAwxp suriq lK lK suriq GVweI
transliteration: Lakh Siaanap Surati Lakh Lakh Surati Sougharhaaee.
translation: Plenty of cleverness, consciousness and knowledge of skills are available.

gurmukhi: igAwn iDAwn ismrx shMs lK piq vifAweI
transliteration: Giaan Dhiaan Simarani Sahans Lakh Pati Vadiaaee.
translation: Similarly knowledges, meditations, remembrances and eulogies are there in thousands.

gurmukhi: haumY AMdir vrqxw dir Qwie n pweI
transliteration: Haoumai Andari Varatanaa Dari Daai N Paaee.
translation: Having all this and behaving in arrogant manner, one does not get place at the door of the Lord.

gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Pl Agm hY siqgur srxweI ]15]
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phal Agam Hai Satigur Saranaaee ?15?
translation: The pleasure fruit of gurmukh's coming in the shelter of Guru is unapproachable.

gurmukhi: 16 gurisK sqoguxI suKwN qoN aucw iprm rs ivc hY
translation: Gursikh transcending pure pleasures remains in the delight of love

gurmukhi: siq sMqoK dieAw Drmu lK ArQ imlwhI
transliteration: Sati Santokh Daiaa Dharamu Lakh Arad Milaahee.
translation: If truth, contentment, compassion, dharma and wealth worth lacs are combined;

gurmukhi: Driq Agws pwxI pvx lK qyj qpwhI
transliteration: Dharati Agaas Paanee Pavan Lakh Tayj Tapaahee.
translation: If earth, sky, water, air and immensely bright heat are there;

gurmukhi: iKmwN DIrj lK lK imil soBw srmwhI
transliteration: Khimaan Dheeraj Lakh Laji Mili Sobhaa Saramaahee.
translation: If the combination of forgiveness, patience and myriad modesties put grandeur to shame;

gurmukhi: swNiq shj suK sukiRqw Bwau Bgiq krwhI
transliteration: Saanti Sahaj Soukh Soukritaa Bhaau Bhagatee Karaahee.
translation: If peace, equipoise, good actions motivate for the loving devotion;

gurmukhi: sgl pdwrQ sgl Pl AwnMd vDwhI
transliteration: Sagal Padaarad Sagal Phal Aanad Vadhaahee.
translation: And if they all join to increase the delight further, even then they cannot approach

gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Pl iprm rs iek iqlu n pujwhI ]16]
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phal Pirami Rasu Iku Tilu N Pujaahee ?16?
translation: An iota of the pleasure fruit in the form of loving devotional sentiment of the gurmukhs.

gurmukhi: 17 guris`K Awqmw suKwN qoN au`cw iprm rs ivc hY
translation: Gursikh lives in the sentiment of love above all the spiritual pleasures

gurmukhi: lK lK jog iDAwn imil Dir iDAwnu bhMdy
transliteration: Lakh Lakh Jog Dhiaan Mili Dhari Dhiaanu Bahanday.
translation: If lacs of yogis sit in meditation jointly;

gurmukhi: lK lK suMn smwiD swiD inj Awsx sMdy
transliteration: Lakh Lakh Sounn Samaadhi Saadhi Nij Aasan Sanday.
translation: If lacs of sadhus in meditation of postures go into tranquil trances;

gurmukhi: lK syK ismrx krihN gux igAwn gxMdy
transliteration: Lakh Saykh Simarani Karahi Goun Giaan Gananday.
translation: If lacs of Sesanags keep remembering and eulogizing the Lord;

gurmukhi: mihmwN lK mhwqmwN jYkwr krMdy
transliteration: Mahimaan Lakh Mahaatamaan Jaikaar Karanday.
translation: If lacs of great souls cheerfully applaud Him;

gurmukhi: ausqiq aupmwN lK lK lK Bgq jpMdy
transliteration: Ousatati Oupamaan Lakh Lakh Lakh Bhagati Japanday.
translation: If lacs of devotees eulogize His glories and perform lacs of recitations of His name,

gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Pl iprm rs iek pl n lhMdy ]17]
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Piram Rasu Ik Palu N Lahanday ?17?
translation: Even then they all cannot withstand the one moment of loving delight of a gurmukh.

gurmukhi: 18 gurisK iprm ros ivsmwd qoN au`cw hY vwh vwh
translation: The loving delight of gurmukh is above all wonders

gurmukhi: Acrj no Awcrju hY Acrju hovMdw
transliteration: Acharaj No Aacharaju Hai Acharaju Hovandaa.
translation: Even the most wonderful wonder becomes full of wonder in the presence of loving delight.

gurmukhi: ivsmwdy ivsmwdu hY ivsmwdu rhMdw
transliteration: Visamaadai Visamaadu Hai Visamaadu Rahandaa.
translation: Before love, awe also feels itself full of awe.

gurmukhi: hYrwxy hYrwxu hY hYrwxu krMdw
transliteration: Hairaanai Hairaanu Hai Hairaanu Karandaa.
translation: Love makes even the surprise full of surprise.

gurmukhi: AibgqhuN Aibgqu hY nihN AlKu lKMdw
transliteration: Abigatahu Abigatu Hai Nahi Alakhu Lakhandaa.
translation: Unmanifest to unmanifestation, that unperceptible Lord cannot be perceived.

gurmukhi: AkQhuN AkQ AlyK hY nyiq nyiq suxMdw
transliteration: Akadahu Akad Alaykhu Hai Nayti Nayti Sounandaa.
translation: He is beyond all descriptions and is known as neti neti, this is not, this is not.

gurmukhi: gurmuK suK Pl iprm rs vwhu vwhu cvMdw ]18]
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Piram Rasu Vaahu Vaahu Chavandaa ?18?
translation: The pleasure fruit of gurmukhs is delight of love which causes him to say wondrous, wonderful!

gurmukhi: 19 iprm rs pRwpqI dw vsIlw-gurU, siqsMg, nwm, haUmy qXwg
translation: Guru, holy congregation, nam and shedding of ego are the means for the attainment of the loving delight)    -, , ,

gurmukhi: iek kvwau pswau kir bHmMf pswry
transliteration: Iku Kavaau Pasaau Kari Brahamand Pasaaray.
translation: The Lord spreading His one vibration, created all the universes.

gurmukhi: kir bHmMf kroV lK rom rom sMjwry
transliteration: Kari Brahamand Karorh Lakh Rom Rom Sanjaaray.
translation: Having created lacs and crores of universes He subsumes them in His each trichome.

gurmukhi: pwrbHm pUrx bHm guru rUpu murwry
transliteration: Paarabraham Pooran Braham Guru Roopu Muraaray.
translation: That Murdri; killer of Mur demon, the transcendent Brahm is the perfect Guru Brahm.

gurmukhi: guru cylw cylw gurU gur sbd vIcwry
transliteration: Guru Chaylaa Chaylaa Guroo Gur Sabadu Veechaaray.
translation: Under His influence the Guru becoming disciple and the disciple becoming Guru, they ponder upon the word of the Guru, i.e. the Guru and the disciple have subsumed in each other.

gurmukhi: swDsMgiq sc KMf hY vwsw inrMkwry
transliteration: Saadhasangati Sachu Khand Hai Vaasaa Nirankaaray.
translation: Holy congregation is the abode of truth wherein resides the word of the formless One.

gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Pl iprm rs dyih haumY mwry ]19]
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Piram Rasu Day Haoumai Maaray ?19?
translation: Bestowing loving delight on the gurmukhs, this holy congregation wipes out their ego.

gurmukhi: 20 Kt gur ausqiq
translation: Praises of the six Gurus

gurmukhi: siqgur nwnk dyau hY prmysur soeI
transliteration: Satiguru Naanak Dayu Hai Paramaysaru Soee.
translation: Guru Nanak is the true Guru and is God Himself.

gurmukhi: guru AMgdu guru AMg qy joqI joiq smoeI
transliteration: Guru Angadu Guru Ang Tay Jotee Joti Samoee.
translation: From the limb of this Guru was created Guru Angad and his flame merged in his (Guru Angad' s ) flame.

gurmukhi: Amrwpd guru AMgdhuN huie jwxu jxoeI
transliteration: Amaraapadu Guru Angadahu Hui Jaanu Janoee.
translation: From Guru Angad the omniscient Guru Amar Das emerged who was given the status of Guru.

gurmukhi: guru AmrhuN gurU rwmdws AMmiRq rsu BoeI
transliteration: Guru Amarahu Guroo Raamadaas Anmrit Rasu Bhoee.
translation: From Amar Das came into being Guru Ram Das who was quaffer of the nectar.

gurmukhi: rwmdwshuN Arjn gurU guru sbd sQoeI
transliteration: Raamadaasahu Arajanu Guroo Guru Sabad Sadoee.
translation: From Ram Das came Guru Arjan Dev, the companion of the Guru's word.

gurmukhi: hirgoivMd guru ArjnhuN guru goivMd hoeI
transliteration: Harigovind Guru Arajanahu Guru Govindu Hoee.
translation: From Guru Arjan emerged Guru Hargobind, Guru and God in one.

gurmukhi: gurmuK suK Pl iprm rs siqsMg AloeI
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phal Piram Rasu Satisang Aloee.
translation: The gurmukhs in the holy congregation came face to face of the pleasure fruit of loving delight.

gurmukhi: guru goivMdhuN bwihrw dUjw nhIN koeI ]20]38]
transliteration: Guru Govindahu Baahiraa Doojaa Nahee Koee ?20?38?atdateeha?
translation: Nothing in this world is outside the Guru and God.

gurmukhi: pUrn bHm gur ibrK ibQwr Dwr mun kMd swKw pqR Aink pRkwr hY
transliteration: Pooran Braham Gur Birakh Bidaar Dhaara , Moun Kand Saakhaa Patr Anik Prakaar Hai ?
translation: Satguru, a total form of complete Lord is like a fragrant tree, whose spread has many branches, leaves, flowers in the form of Sikhs.

gurmukhi: qw mY inj rUp gurisK Pl ko pRgws bwsnw subws Aau sÍwd aupkwr hY
transliteration: Taa Mai Nij Roop Gursikh Dhal Ko Pragaasa , Baasanaa Soubaas Au Svaad Oupakaar Hai ?
translation: By the strenuous toil of devoted Sikhs like Bhai Lehna Ji and Baba Amar Das Ji, the True Guru illuminated His own light in them. Engulfed in the desire of worship and fragrance of the Lord, these pious souls are keen to spread and distribute the elixir-li

gurmukhi: crn kml mkrMd rs risk huie cwKy crnwmiRq sMswr ko auDwr hY
transliteration: Charan Kamal Makarand Ras Rasik Hui , Chaakhay Charanaamrit Sansaar Ko Udhaar Hai ?
translation: Such Gursikhs enjoying the fragrance of the dust of Lord's lotus-feet emancipate others from the world.

gurmukhi: gurmuiK mwrg mhwqm AkQ kQw nyiq nyiq nyiq nmo nmo nmskwr hY ]38]
transliteration: Gurmukhi Maarag Mahaatam Akad Kadaa , Nayti Nayti Nayti Namo Namo Namasakaar Hai ?38?
translation: The glory of the path of Sikhism cannot be described. All that we can say is that He is infinite, infinite and beyond and is worthy of our salutes myriad times. (38)
